channel.title: GTX 570 fail
channel.description:
Played Crysis the other day and for some reason the fps were locked to 24... Any ideas?
I'm using an hdtv at 60Hz i7 950 processor...

item.title: GTX 570 fail
item.dc:creator: Bloodshot
item.description:
It’s definitely gotta be the Refresh rate or something, I just got a GTX 560 and i can run it on very high no AA at 1680x1050 with 50+ fps, so your’s should be fine for it.

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 570 fail
item.dc:creator: Debdibib
item.description:
As stated above it is probably the tvsettings fault. Check in nvidia control panel and make sure the refresh rate is set to 60hz and not 23/24.(It should be found in display/change resolution)

Read full topic

item.description:
DrasarSalman:

Actually, crytech are from the future and their games are made for quantum computers made in April 2167! The best quality you can get on it today is really the lowest even in the year 2078. :retard:

lern2singularitydefinition

idiot

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 570 fail
item.dc:creator: BaTz281
item.description:
GConstantine:

Sometimes HDTV using HDMI is configured using 1080p/24p, which is 24fps. If you have V-sync enabled, and the nvidia drivers detect and use 1080p/24p, crysis will lock to 24FPS. Try it with any monitor (other than TV) and see if there is a difference.

Or you could also disable V-Sync and see. If you get max 24FPS, at any setting, then this is probably the problem.

I was thinking that, but I didn’t know if a monitor/TV can actually limit the FPS output of a graphics card. Is that possible? The moment he said 24fps I thought of the 24fps limit of TV, but I didn’t feel well-versed enough in the subject to recommend it.

Edit: even if it’s not the case, can’t hurt to try a different monitor and disable VSYNC.

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 570 fail
item.dc:creator: GConstantine
item.description:
Sometimes HDTV using HDMI is configured using 1080p/24p, which is 24fps. If you have V-sync enabled, and the nvidia drivers detect and use 1080p/24p, crysis will lock to 24FPS. Try it with any monitor (other than TV) and see if there is a difference.

Or you could also disable V-Sync and see. If you get max 24FPS, at any setting, then this is probably the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 570 fail
item.dc:creator: fx1
item.description:
Sidewinder:

I’m on a HD6950 with 8GB 1600Mhz Ram, AMD Hexcore 1100T Black Edition @ 3.3 Ghz and Crysis Warhead sat around 40FPS, that’s with everything plopped on Enthusiest.

Shrug I didn’t care, atleast It didn’t look like I was playing Manic Miner in slow motion.

1100T on only 3.3? Dude, what are you thinking? OC it for fucks sake
I got my 970 on 3.7 and my 5770 on 910/1250. Your 6950 is way better than mine, and yet I have better FPS in regular Crysis

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 570 fail
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
Is the GPU load high? If not, the GPU might be switching to lower clock frequencies to save energy. I had this glitch one time that when I went back to the desktop while playing a game the GPU would switch to the power saving mode thus giving me horrible performance. I managed to fix it by forcing the clocks through RivaTuner.

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 570 fail
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
Get a second GTA 570 and SLI

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 570 fail
item.dc:creator: Zageron
item.description:
Have you tried all of the generic fixes?
Uninstall drivers, Driver Sweep, Reinstall newest drivers.

Does your motherboard have any specific instructions for video card installing, and if so have they been followed?

Is your power-supply good enough? Are you doing SLI?
Is the TV set up with your computer properly?

Read full topic

item.title: GTX 570 fail
item.dc:creator: Siggs
item.description:
Vitriol:

I’ve got an ASUS GTX570 and I can max Crysis with no AA at ~60fps 1680x1050 (lowest it got was ~30fps in my last playthrough IIRC). I’m using CCC v3.00 at 4+ (highest setting) and set I set physics to run on core 3.

Core i5-750
4GB cheap DDR3 RAM
Antec TP750W PSU

lol, CCC…

Read full topic
